priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Laboratory Test Standard Character Result Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C102580

self.title: CDISC SDTM Laboratory Test Standard Character Result Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the standardized results, in character format, for laboratory tests.
name: Laboratory Test Standard Character Result
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Laboratory Test Standard Character Result Terminology

terms.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm. (NCI)
Not existing in a specified place at a specified time. (NCI)
Straddling the dividing line between two categories.
A finding indicating that an entity or characteristic is perceived, discerned, or discovered.
Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context. (NCI)
An indication of a negative finding for a test or assessment, such as for a disease, condition, analyte, or microorganism.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)
A finding indicating that an entity or characteristic is not perceived, discerned, or discovered.
An indication of an affirmative finding for a test or assessment, such as for a disease, condition, analyte, or microorganism.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time. (NCI)
A positive finding that is strong in intensity, power, or magnitude.
A subjective finding indicating the presence of entities that are deemed too numerous to accurately quantify.
A positive finding that is weak in intensity, power, or magnitude.
